content:

name: validate_email_for_validate_email
content: The tool output is {"error": "", "response": "{'status': 200, 'message': 'Success', 'result': [{'email': 'testing.com', 'isValid': False, 'failureType': 'regex', 'username': 'testing.com', 'regex_validation': {'value': False, 'reason': 'Email does not contain \"@\".'}, 'typo_validation': {'value': False}, 'disposable_validation': {'value': False}, 'mx_validation': {'value': False}, 'smtp_validation': {'value': False}}]}"}, remember to call Finish tool when either if you believe that you have obtained a result that can answer the task, please call this function to provide the final answer. Remember: you must ALWAYS call this function at the end of your attempt, and the only part that will be shown to the user is the final answer, so it should contain sufficient information.

function.arguments: {"final_answer":"The email address testing.com is invalid because it does not contain an \"@\" symbol.","return_type":"give_answer"}
function.name: Finish
